description:
#### Backs up SQL Server databases to a local volume and optionally uploads the backup files to Amazon S3. 
---
#### Prerequisites for using this document:
* Instance(s) must be running SQL Server.
* An AWS Secrets Manager database credential must be configured with the following two fields: **username** and **password**. For instructions, see [AWS Secrets Manager](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/secretsmanager/latest/userguide/auth-and-access.html).
* On Windows, the **username** and **password** must be the domain account and password used to authenticate SQL Server. The domain user must be a local administrator.
* On Linux, the **username** and **password** must be the SQL Server login  name and password.
* The **username** must be assigned, at minimum, the following database role: **sysadmin**. 
* Instances may need to be granted additional permissions and roles that allow access to AWS Secrets Manager credentials and Amazon S3. For more information, see the [documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/launchwizard/latest/userguide/launch-wizard-sql-provided-runbooks.html).
---

*Note: This document installs and uses third-party software from [https://ola.hallengren.com](https://ola.hallengren.com), which is provided under the following license: [https://ola.hallengren.com/license.html](https://ola.hallengren.com/license.html)*.

BackupType.description: Select FULL for complete backup, DIFF for differential backup, LOG for transaction log backup

Directory.description: Directory path for the local backup. For example, C:\backup (Windows) or /home/user/backup (Linux)

BackupRetentionPolicy.description: Retention policy for local backup files
allowedValues: Delete older backups after successful backup (specify retention time in DeleteBackupsOlderThan)
Delete older backups before backup (specify retention time in DeleteBackupsOlderThan)

DeleteBackupsOlderThan.description: Retention time, in hours, for local backup files (used by "Delete older backups...");  0 means never delete

SecretsMangerCredential.description: Name of the AWS Secrets Manager database secret

S3Bucket.description: Optionally specified Amazon S3 bucket name to which to upload backup. For example, my-backup-bucket

S3BucketFolder.description: Optionally specified non-public Amazon S3 folder to store backups, which must be specified for S3Bucket

InstanceId.description: Target SQL Server instance on which to perform the backup operation

ThirdPartySoftwareConsent.description: Consent to the use third-party software mentioned in description
